results.title: Eight parts of a business letter
results.creator_credit: G Russell Taylor, Library Films and William Lewin
results.brief_description: Shows how mail is handled, why letters are standardised as to form in business, difference between social and business forms, heading, introductory address, salutation, complimentary close, signature, outside address, return address, proper folding and enclosing of business letters, two-page letters, window envelope, basic display and arrangement.

results.title: Eight out of ten
results.brief_description: In its appeals, the American Cancer Society has found that eight out of ten people will give money if properly approached. Here is shows how the successful first appeal of the Arizona section was run; from the recruiting of chairman and leaders, through publicity and education, to the vital face-to-face method of appeal.

results.title: Eight or nine in the morning
results.creator_credit: Felix Greene and Felix Greene Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Mans China”.
An insight into China’s new educational ideas - old traditions have been abandoned, and education today is non-competitive, with exams rarely given. Looks at the status of intellectuals and touches on background philosophy since the revolution. Suitable for secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Eight months to Mars
results.creator_credit: United States. National Aeronautics Space Administration
results.brief_description: This film shows the problems encountered in sending Mariner IV 325 million miles through space to explore Mars. Designed to inform the layperson in terms which will be understood, the film also explains scientific readings and photographs from Mariner IV. Narrated by John Fitch.

results.title: Eight minutes to midnight
results.creator_credit: Fund for Theatre and Film and Mary Benjamin
results.brief_description: A portrait of Dr Helen Caldicott, Australian-born but US-based paediatrician and author. Describes her struggle to inform and arouse the public in the USA and Australia to the medical dangers of a nuclear attack. Includes scenes of 1979 return to Australia on a tour to promote her book “Nuclear Madness”; Today Tonight interview, and discussions with Government and other radio interviews. We also see Dr Caldicott in the Northern Territory where she meets with union officials and presents her case against uranium mining. Co-director and cinematographer: Boyd Estus. “New Mexican Sundown” written and performed by Lisa Gilkyson. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Eight millimeter [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Joel Schumacher, Judy Hofflund and Gavin Polone
results.brief_description: A widow settling her husband’s estate, finds an 8mm film in his safe. The film on the reel is a “snuff” film, and shows a young girl being tortured and killed. Upset by the film, she hires private detective Tom Welles (Nicolas Cage) to find the girl on the film and determine if the film is real. When Tom learns the girl on the film is a runaway, his investigation takes him to Hollywood, where with the help of Max (Joaquin Phoenix), a clerk in an adult bookstore, he discovers the world of underground pornography, and his initial investigation becomes an obsession.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Columbia Pictures, Joel Schumacher, Judy Hofflund and Gavin Polone

results.title: Eight litres a minute
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Battle for the planet”.
Profiles a serious form of air pollution in the West: acid rain particularly addressing the export of air pollution to the Third World as evidenced in Mexico and Brazil. As meaningful attempts seek to solve acid rain in Europe, European and North American corporations are relocating their dirty industries to countries with lower pollution standards. Third World governments admit polluters as they bring the promise of employment and wealth. Examines the impact on the people of Mexico City and the refinery city of Cubatao in Brazil. In both cities 45-50% of the major polluting companies are foreign and have been attracted by weak environmental legislation. In Mexico City, 20 million people, 3 million cars, 100,000 buses and thousands of trucks create an enormous pollution problem. In Cubatao, in the Amazon rainforest forest, air pollution, water pollution and soil degradation are in tragic dimensions with 30% of deaths caused by respiratory problems.

results.title: Eight in the 80's
results.brief_description: Showcases eight interesting and innovative films made on the low budget medium of Super 8. Because of the gauge’s low cost and extreme flexibility the filmmakers using Super 8 have a freedom that allows them to create genuinely exciting and rich works, ranging from diaristic experimental films to straighter narrative dramas through to absurdist, surrealistic comedies.

results.title: Egyptian villagers
results.brief_description: Examines the village and family life in a small Egyptian farming community, and the future for those who live in villages throughout the country. Illustrates how education brings social change, and the blend of ancient and modern farming methods and patterns.

results.title: Egypte
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Don Worobey, Peter Jones, John Taylor and Al Razutis
results.brief_description: Time-lapse photography, combined with chanted music, gives an impressionistic and highly moving view of the great monuments of Egypt where art and civilisation once flowered some 5,000 years ago
